descript.abstract: Feature class created by the N.C. State Historic Preservation Office to delineate the boundaries of historic districts designated by local ordinance in those municipalities and counties that have established historic preservation commissions under G.S. 160A-400.1-400.14. Boundaries of a few selected local landmarks are also included. This is a work in progress.
descript.purpose: Show boundaries of locally zoned historic districts under G.S. 160A-400.1-400.15.
descript.supplinf: Some local districts are also designated under one of the federal or state preservation program designations. See the NC_NR-SL-DOE_Boundaries feature class for comparison.

idinfo.useconst: Users are advised that data is amended by the HPO on a daily basis, and shapefiles extracted on a fixed date are quickly outdated. Contact the HPO for details about web mapping services that display current data.
idinfo.datacred: State Historic Preservation Office, Office of Archives and History, North Carolina Department of Cultural Resources
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

dataqual.logic: Local district boundaries have been obtained from multiple sources. Some are copies or near copies of National Register historic district boundaries. Some were obtained as shapefiles from local preservaton commissions or drawn from maps provided by commissions.
dataqual.complete: Roughly 80% of the state's 100 locally designated districts are included. This is a work in progress.

cntorgp.cntorg: North Carolina State Historic Preservation Office

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
